column4: does anybody else have any idea why this ubuntu install is hanging at 89% on "checking for packages to remove" ?
Is it connected to the net while installing?
I'm using the box right now to speak here... it doesn't lock the machine
Have you tried installing without being connected?
I haven't - but should that cause a problem? And will I have to now start the whole thing again?
I guess it can't hurt to try disconnecting now
I'm confused. Are you saying that you're currently on one machine chatting here, and looking at another machine that has hung at "removing packages"
I'm using the machine that I'm installing ubuntu on (live CD)

If you begin the installation connected to the net, and during installation you lose your connection, it could cause the installation to hang as it looks for repos that were available at the start of install but are no longer. That's just a guess. In any event, if you've checked for errors the next thing I'd try is disconnecting the cd. I'm sorry I can't be more specific.
I haven't disconnected the net, or anything. The machine was left alone and twice it's done the same thing :(
Excuse me, not disconnecting the cd, but disconnecting the network while installing.
are you saying there are install logs I can see now?

I understand. All the same, if you've checked the cd for errors then the next thing I would try is to install without being connected. When you get to the part that says "autoconfigurig network failed" just skip it and say "dont' configure now I'll configure later".
If at that point you still hang and have errors, I would switch to the alternate cd.
